page.title: 18CHURCH FARM HISTORY
page.content: A{stone axe}over 4000 years old was found here so the land has been settled for a long time. The farm was built as a{Long House}in the 1400's and was open to the roof with holes to let out smoke. Probably people chose to live there because of: the soil, nearby supplies of stone and trees, springs. It must have been an important house because there is a field called{conigre}where rabbits were bred. Only lords of the manor were allowed to have these. The house has a well 2m. wide and 7m. deep. It is covered by flagstones in the kitchen now. Later on ,in Elizabeth 1st's reign, the house was divided into two storeys and shaped like a capital{"E" for Elizabeth.}The family who live there can trace their tree back 500 years.
